item.title: Expert Cat.III – Research Expert on data protection and the media
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Data Protection and the Media

The global objective of the project is to contribute to a more effective exercise of the right to privacy and personal data protection while maintaining a balance with the right to freedom of expression and information. The assignment consists of providing technical assistance in the process of developing policies and tools for better implementation of principles for personal data protection by the media, after a first quantitative assessment of the current state of affairs. In addition to the evaluation, trainings and seminars shall be provided to representatives of Institutions and Media Associations.

item.title: Senior Agricultural Economist Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the EU Budget Support Programmes ‘Accompanying Measures for Sugar Protocol (AMSP)’ Countries Trinidad & Tobago 2007-2013

Global objective:

Provide an independent assessment of the performance of the programme and its components, particularly the impact and sustainability of the projects undertaken. In addition, identify key lessons and propose practical recommendations for potential follow-up actions by the Government and possible exit strategy.

Specific objectives:

To provide an overall independent assessment of the performance of the budget support programmes focusing mainly on sector results. The evaluation should use the standard OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC) evaluation criteria of relevance, effectiveness, impact, and sustainability and with specific attention to the Government’s goals of food security, economic diversification, and environmental protection. The study should also assess to what extent former subsidies to sugar have continued after the end of sugar production on former Caroni lands as well as the integration and impact of the cross-cutting issue gender mainstreaming. N.B.: since the study focusses on sector results, not required is an evaluation of the first and third general condition of the FA, i.e. (i) “stability oriented macro-economic policies”, and (iii) “A Suitable and credible programme to improve public financial management exists and is under implementation”. Finally, a video is to be produced that summarizes the goals and major achievements of the EU support for possible publication.

Expert 2: Agricultural Economist Expert (Senior)

Education Masters level in agricultural economics, economics or trade or a similar area of study.

Proven Experience

  • of at least 12 years in rural/agriculture research, analysis and/or rural/agriculture development projects,
  • in working with rural diversification and competitiveness of at least one project of at least one year duration;
  • in project in an international cooperation programme of at least 1 year duration is an asset;
  • experience in strategic planning and development of assistance programmes is an asset;
  • in principles and working methods of project cycle management and evaluation tools is an asset;
  • in Caribbean and/or Central America is an asset.

Language skills Excellent knowledge of English both orally and written.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

Assessment of Justice Budget Support Benchmarks Tranche 3 & 4

Global objective The general objective of the present contract is to provide two detailed reviews and two overall assessments of the implementation of the EU Sector Reform Contract in support to the justice sector reform in Jordan.

Specific objective(s) Specific objectives are to develop a clear assessment of progress of Jordan’s implementation of developments/reforms in the anticipated field for tranche 3 and tranche 4; the experts shall have the following main objectives:

  • Collect all relevant compliance documents concerning the achievement of the general and specific reform benchmarks related to the Sector Reform Contract (SRC) programme; and
  • To analyse factually the conformity of the compliance documentation obtained as foreseen in the implementation plan annexed to the Technical and Administrative Provisions (TAPs) of the SRC support programme.
  • To analyse whether the public policy eligibility criterion continue to be satisfied.
  • To contribute to maintain a high level of clarity, and a shared understanding by all stakeholders regarding the steps required to ensure the relevant tranche releases for reform benchmarks met.

Expert in Justice Sector and Reform in Jordan, Category II

*Education * Certified university degree, in law, at master equivalent or above (compulsory)

General professional experience At least 7 years' experience in the sector (s) related to the lot.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 7 years of recent professional experience directly related to justice sector development and reform.
  • Excellent experience in Jordan with justice sector development and reform (necessary).
  • Knowledge of the context of the Jordanian justice sector (necessary).
  • An excellent Knowledge of EU external aid procedures, project cycle management principles, direct budget support methodology and evaluation will be an asset.
  • Experience in working in an international context with experts and local professionals

Language skills The main language of the assignment is English; all experts should be perfectly fluent in English. And at least one of the category I team members (preferably the team leader) should also be fluent in Arabic as the verification documents are in Arabic supported by explanatory cover letters in English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Expert Agronome
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation des PNR 2015 et 2016 Mali

Objectif 1:- Une appréciation globale et indépendante des Plans Nationaux de Réponses aux difficultés alimentaires et nutritionnelles 2015 et 2016 et de leurs opérations,

Objectif 2:- Les principaux enseignements des interventions et des recommandations afin d’améliorer les futures actions,

Objectif 3:- L'ensemble des éléments nécessaires à la mesure de la progression du taux des populations vulnérables assistées par le CSA par rapport aux populations vulnérables identifiées par le SAP (Phase 2 à 5) et un avis sur l'atteinte de l'indicateur de performance du DNSA.

Expert Agronome

  • Diplôme universitaire supérieur en Agronomie (ou équivalent), bac + 5 ou expérience professionnelle équivalente ;
  • Expérience professionnelle de 6 ans au minimum dans l'agriculture et le développement rural en Afrique sub-saharienne.
  • Expérience professionnelle de 3 ans minimum dans la mise en œuvre, dans le monitoring ou dans l'évaluation de projet d'aide alimentaire et/ou de transfert de cash.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com
